articles.description: Chelsea and Liverpool play out a thrilling draw as both sides illustrate why they are doing battle over £110m Brighton midfielder Moises Caicedo.
articles.title: Disasi earns point for Chelsea against Liverpool

articles.description: Jamie Smith's maiden fifty in The Hundred helps Birmingham Phoenix to a 41-run victory over Oval Invincibles - their first win of the 2023 season.
articles.title: Impressive Smith helps Phoenix beat Invincibles

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at the beginning of the Ange Postecoglou era amid the backdrop of Harry Kane's exit at Tottenham.
articles.title: ‘Impediment or opportunity’ – can Spurs find a new ‘superstar’?

articles.description: Lilia Vu produces a composed display to win the Women's Open at Walton Heath, the American's second major title of 2023.
articles.title: Vu sees off England's Hull to win Women's Open

articles.description: Champions Celtic hold off a spirited Aberdeen to make it two wins out of two in the Scottish Premiership.
articles.title: Champions Celtic continue winning start at Aberdeen

articles.description: New £86m signing Harry Kane says "I've got plenty of football left in my career" after making his Bayern Munich debut.
articles.title: I didn't want to end my career with regrets - Kane

articles.description: Watch as Great Britain's Beth Shriever wins the women's BMX Racing Supercross title at the 2023 Cycling World Championships in Scotland.
articles.title: 'Get me the champagne now!' - GB's Shriever wins BMX Supercross gold

articles.description: Watch the best plays from Sunday's action in The Hundred, featuring Tom Banton, Harry Brook and Sophie Ecclestone.
articles.title: Banton's brilliant stumping leads plays of the day

articles.description: La Liga champions Barcelona begin their 2023-24 title with a trip to the Coliseum Alfonso Perez to face Getafe.
articles.title: La Liga: Barcelona travel to Getafe - Gundogan starts

articles.description: Play is halted briefly at the Women's Open in Surrey after protesters with flares make their way on to the 17th green.
articles.title: Protesters interrupt play at Women's Open
